summary: This document is a chain of emails between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the handling of Touhy requests (requests for government information in third-party litigation) from victims of Jeffrey Epstein. It details internal coordination on responding to requests, including one from an Epstein victim represented by Roberta Kaplan, and discusses complexities regarding access to investigative materials from other districts (S.D. Fla. and N.D. Ga.).

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: Primary point person for handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims; drafts response letters and coordinates with colleagues on document production and legal strategy.

persons.name: John McEnany
persons.context: Senior AUSA providing guidance and approval on Touhy request responses; consulted on legal strategy regarding jurisdiction and document production.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Criminal AUSA involved in the Epstein case; coordinates with civil division on Touhy requests and communicates with victim's counsel.

persons.name: David Jones
persons.context: CC'd on emails discussing Touhy request strategies; consulted on the reasonableness of proposed approaches.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney representing an Epstein victim (plaintiff) who submitted a Touhy request for information; recipient of initial response letter from the USAO.

persons.name: Maria Lacerda
persons.context: Identified in an email as the 'Jane Doe' who is an Epstein victim and plaintiff submitting a Touhy request; previously received a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: Referred to as a 'wiser Touhy head' in the Civil Division to be consulted on complex jurisdictional questions regarding Touhy requests.

persons.name: Jeffrey O
persons.context: Mentioned as having been consulted about continuing to use Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Epstein-related Touhy requests.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: CC'd on an email and noted as having signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: CC'd on an email and noted as having signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Rossmiller
persons.context: Mentioned in draft Touhy language as the initial recipient of a request for information, with the matter then handed to Steven Kochevar.

connections.description: Frequent email correspondence where Kochevar seeks McEnany's guidance, approval, and feedback on handling Touhy requests related to Epstein.
Collaborate on managing Touhy requests; Alex coordinates with victim's counsel and Kochevar handles the civil division response process.
Kaplan is identified as counsel for the victim/plaintiff Maria Lacerda, who is making a Touhy request for documents.
Kochevar is the government attorney responsible for sending the formal Touhy process response letter to Kaplan, who represents the victim.
McEnany states he spoke to Jeffrey O about designating Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Epstein-related Touhy requests.

events.title: Designation of Touhy Request Point Person
events.description: John McEnany confirms that Steven Kochevar will be the point of contact for handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims, following a conversation with Jeffrey O.

events.title: Approval for Document Production to Victim
events.description: John McEnany approves the production of documents, including a previously disclosed grand jury subpoena, to victim Maria Lacerda in response to her Touhy request.

events.title: Closure of Initial Touhy Request
events.description: Steven Kochevar informs the team that documents were produced to an Epstein victim a month prior, and they intend to deny follow-up requests, directing the victim to other districts for additional materials.

events.title: Coordination with Maxwell Team on Response
events.description: Steven Kochevar sends an updated response letter to an Epstein victim's Touhy request, noting that the 'Maxwell team' (presumably Ghislaine Maxwell's defense) has signed off on the version.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) had an established process for handling Touhy requests from victims of Jeffrey Epstein involved in civil litigation.
Internal emails reveal coordination with the 'Maxwell team' (Ghislaine Maxwell's defense) on the content of a response letter to a victim's Touhy request.

The office possessed FBI investigative files from the Southern District of Florida's Epstein investigation but deliberately avoided obtaining files from the S.D. Fla. U.S. Attorney's Office due to conflict issues and the prior non-prosecution agreement.
Victim Maria Lacerda was identified as a 'Jane Doe' plaintiff, and the office approved producing a grand jury subpoena to her as it had been previously disclosed.

There was internal debate about jurisdictional responsibility for Touhy requests related to the S.D. Fla. investigation, with consideration of referring requesters to the Northern District of Georgia, which had 'stepped into the shoes' of S.D. Fla. for Epstein matters.
